verses.english: I sent them to Iddo, who was the chief at a place called Casiphia. I gave them specific instructions about what to say to Iddo and his relatives, the Nethinim, who were living in Casiphia—all with the purpose of bringing us ministers for the house of our God.

verses.latin: Et adduxerunt nobis per manum Dei nostri bonam, virum doctissimum de filiis Moholi filii Levi, filii Israel, et Sarabiam et filios ejus et fratres ejus decem et octo.
verses.english: And through the good hand of our God upon us, they brought us a highly skilled man from the descendants of Mahli, son of Levi, son of Israel—that was Sherebiah, with his sons and brothers, a total of eighteen men.

verses.latin: Et Hasabiam, et cum eo Isaiam de filiis Merari, fratres ejus, et filios ejus viginti.
verses.english: They also brought Hashabiah, and with him, from the descendants of Merari, Isaiah, along with his brothers and his sons, a total of twenty men.

verses.latin: Et de Nathinaeis, quos dederat David et principes ad ministeria Levitarum, Nathinaeos ducentos viginti: omnes hi nominatim.
verses.english: And from the Nethinim, whom King David and the leaders had assigned to assist the Levites in their service, they brought two hundred and twenty Nethinim; all these were designated by name.

verses.latin: Et praedicavi ibi jejunium juxta fluvium Ahava, ut affligeremur coram Deo nostro, et peteremus ab eo viam rectam nobis et filiis nostris universaeque substantiae nostrae.
verses.english: There, by the Ahava River, I proclaimed a fast for everyone. This was so that we might humble ourselves before our God and ask Him for a safe and proper journey for ourselves, our children, and all our possessions.

verses.latin: Erubui enim petere a rege auxilium et equites, qui defenderent nos ab inimico in via: quia dixeramus regi: Manus Dei nostri est super omnes, qui quaerunt eum in bonitate: et potestas ejus et fortitudo et furor super omnes qui derelinquunt eum.
verses.english: I was ashamed to ask the king for soldiers and horsemen to protect us from our enemies along the way. This was because we had already told the king, 'The hand of our God is good and protects all those who seek Him with sincerity, but His power, strength, and wrath are against all who abandon Him.'

verses.latin: Jejunavimus itaque, et petivimus a Deo nostro per hoc, et propitius fuit nobis.
verses.english: So we fasted and sought help from our God through prayer for this very reason, and He was gracious to us.

verses.latin: Et separavi de principibus sacerdotum duodecim, Sarabiam et Hasabiam, et cum eis de fratribus suis decem.
verses.english: Then I set apart twelve of the leading priests: Sherebiah and Hashabiah, and with them ten of their brothers.

verses.latin: Et appendi eis argentum et aurum et vasa sanctorum domus Dei nostri, quae obtulerat rex et consiliatores ejus et principes ejus et omnis Israel, eorum qui inventi fuerant.
verses.english: I weighed out to them the silver, the gold, and the sacred vessels intended for the house of our God—these were offerings that the king, his counselors, his officials, and all the Israelites present had contributed.

verses.latin: Et appendi in manibus eorum argenti talenta sexcenta quinquaginta, et vasa argentea centum, auri centum talenta.
verses.english: I weighed into their hands six hundred and fifty talents of silver, one hundred silver vessels, and one hundred talents of gold.

verses.latin: Et phialas aureas viginti, quas habebant auri solidos millia: et vasa aere clari nitidi quasi aurum, duo.
verses.english: Also, twenty gold bowls, which were worth a thousand gold darics (gold coins), and two vessels of fine, burnished bronze, which were as valuable as gold.

verses.latin: Et dixi eis: Vos sancti Domini, et vasa sancta, et argentum et aurum votum Domini Dei patrum nostrorum.
verses.english: Then I said to them: 'You are consecrated to the Lord, and these vessels are sacred. The silver and gold are a freewill offering to the Lord, the God of our fathers.'

verses.latin: Vigilate, et custodite, donec appendatis coram principibus sacerdotum et Levitarum, et ducibus familiarum Israel in Jerusalem, in thesauro domus Domini.
verses.english: 'Watch over them and guard them carefully until you weigh them out in Jerusalem, in the presence of the leading priests, the Levites, and the heads of the Israelite families, and place them in the treasury of the house of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Susceperunt autem sacerdotes et Levitae pondus argenti et auri et vasorum, ut deferrent Jerusalem in domum Dei nostri.
verses.english: So the priests and the Levites received the exact weight of the silver, gold, and vessels, with the responsibility to transport them to Jerusalem for the house of our God.

verses.latin: Movimus ergo ab affluentia fluminis Ahava duodecimo die mensis primi, ut iremus Jerusalem: et manus Dei nostri fuit super nos, et liberavit nos de manu inimici et insidiatoris in via.
verses.english: Then, on the twelfth day of the first month—the month of Nisan—we departed from the Ahava River to journey to Jerusalem. The good hand of our God was upon us, and He delivered us from the power of the enemy and from ambushers along the road.

verses.latin: Et venimus Jerusalem, et mansimus ibi tribus diebus.
verses.english: We arrived in Jerusalem and rested there for three days.

verses.latin: Die autem quarto, appensum est argentum et aurum et vasa in domo Dei nostri per manum Meremoth filii Uriae sacerdotis, et cum eo Eleazar filius Phinees, ipsi vero Levitis Jozabado filio Jesue, et Noadiae filio Bennoi.
verses.english: On the fourth day, the silver, gold, and vessels were weighed out in the house of our God by the hand of Meremoth, son of Uriah the priest, and with him was Eleazar, son of Phinehas. The Levites present were Jozabad, son of Jeshua, and Noadiah, son of Binnui.

verses.latin: Juxta numerum et pondus omnium: et descriptum est omne pondus in tempore illo.
verses.english: Everything was accounted for by number and by weight; and the entire weight was recorded at that time.

verses.latin: Filii autem transmigrationis, qui venerant de captivitate, obtulerunt holocausta Deo Israel, vitulos duodecim pro omni Israele, arietes nonaginta sex, agnos septuaginta septem, hircos pro peccato duodecim: omnia in holocaustum Domino.
verses.english: The exiles who had returned from captivity then offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel: twelve bulls for all of Israel, ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs, and twelve male goats as a sin offering—all of these were presented as a whole burnt offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dederunt edicta regis satrapis, qui erant de potestate regis, et ducibus trans flumen: et sublevaverunt populum et domum Dei.
verses.english: They also delivered the king’s decrees to the satraps—the provincial governors—and to the officials of the regions beyond the Euphrates River. And these officials then assisted the people and the house of God.

verses.latin: Postquam haec completa sunt, accesserunt ad me principes, dicentes: Non est separatum populus Israel, et sacerdotes et Levitae, a populis terrarum, et abominationibus eorum, Chananaei scilicet, et Hethaei, et Pherezaei, et Jebusaei, et Ammonitae, et Moabitae, et Aegyptii, et Amorrhaei.
verses.english: After these things were completed, the leaders came to me, saying: 'The people of Israel, even the priests and the Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the surrounding peoples of the lands and their detestable practices--the very practices God had forbidden. These nations include the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.'

verses.latin: De filiabus enim eorum duxerunt uxores sibi, et filiis suis, et commiscuerunt semen sanctum cum populis terrarum: manus quoque principum et magistratuum primi fuerunt in hoc scelere.
verses.english: For they have taken wives from the daughters of these nations for themselves and for their sons, and they have mingled the holy lineage--the chosen people of God--with the surrounding peoples of the lands. The hands of the leaders and officials were the very first in this grave offense.

verses.latin: Cumque audissem sermonem istum, scidi vestimentum meum et pallium, et evulsi capillos capitis mei et barbae, et sedi moerens.
verses.english: When I heard this report, I tore my garments and my cloak, and I pulled out some of the hair from my head and my beard, and I sat down in deep mourning.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt ad me omnes, qui timebant verbum Domini Dei Israel, propter transgressionem eorum qui de captivitate venerant, et ego sedebam moerens usque ad vesperam sacrificii.
verses.english: Then all those who feared the word of the Lord, the God of Israel, gathered around me because of the transgression of those who had returned from the captivity. And I remained sitting in mourning until the evening sacrifice--the time of daily atonement.

verses.latin: Et in hora sacrificii, surgens de afflictione mea, in scisso vestimento et pallio, curvavi genua mea, et expandi manus meas ad Dominum Deum meum.
verses.english: At the hour of the evening sacrifice, I rose from my deep affliction, still in my torn garment and cloak. I knelt down and spread out my hands in prayer to the Lord, my God.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Deus meus, confundor et erubesco levare faciem meam ad te: quoniam iniquitates nostrae multiplicatae sunt super caput nostrum, et delicta nostra creverunt usque ad caelum.
verses.english: And I said: 'My God, I am ashamed and embarrassed to lift my face to You, because our iniquities have multiplied over our heads, and our transgressions have grown up to the very heavens--reaching throughout the universe.'

verses.latin: A diebus patrum nostrorum, et nunc usque ad diem hanc, in delicto magno sumus, et propter iniquitates nostras traditi sumus ipsi, et reges nostri, et sacerdotes nostri in manum regum terrarum, et in gladium, et in captivitatem, et in rapinam, et in confusionem vultus sicut et hodie.
verses.english: From the days of our ancestors until this very day, we have been in great transgression. Because of our iniquities, we ourselves, our kings, and our priests have been handed over into the hand of the kings of the surrounding lands--delivered to the sword, to captivity, to plunder, and to open shame, just as it is today.

verses.latin: Et nunc quasi parvulum aliquantum factum est, ut relinquatur reliquiae, et sit salus in sanctis suis: et illuminet Deus noster oculos nostros, et det nobis requiem modicam in servitute nostra.
verses.english: And now, for a brief moment, a small remnant has been allowed to remain, and there is a place of safety among His holy people. Our God has enlightened our eyes and given us a small measure of relief in our bondage.

verses.latin: Quia servi sumus, et in servitute nostra non dereliquit nos Deus noster, sed inclinavit super nos misericordiam in conspectu regis Persarum, ut daret nobis vitam, et ut erigeremus domum Dei nostri, et instauremus solitudines ejus, et daret nobis sepem in Juda et Jerusalem.
verses.english: Though we are servants, our God has not abandoned us in our servitude. Instead, He has extended His mercy to us in the sight of the king of Persia, so that He might give us new life. He has allowed us to rebuild the house of our God, to restore its desolate ruins, and to grant us a protective wall--a firm establishment--in Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et nunc quid dicemus, Deus noster, post haec? quia dereliquimus mandata tua,
verses.english: And now, our God, what can we say after these things? For we have forsaken Your commandments,

verses.latin: quae praecepisti in manu servorum tuorum prophetarum, dicens: Terra ad quam ingredimini ut possideatis eam, terra immunda est, juxta immunditiam populorum terrarum, abominationibus eorum, qui impleverunt eam ab ore usque ad os in coinquinatione sua.
verses.english: which You commanded through the hand of Your servants, the prophets, saying: 'The land into which you are entering to possess it is an unclean land, according to the uncleanness of the peoples of the lands and their detestable practices. They have filled it from one end to the other with their defilement.'

verses.latin: Et nunc filias vestras ne detis filiis eorum, et filias eorum ne accipiatis filiis vestris, et non quaeratis pacem eorum, et prosperitatem eorum usque in aeternum: ut confortemini, et comedatis bona terrae, et haereditate tradatis filiis vestris usque in sempiternum.
verses.english: And now, you shall not give your daughters to their sons, nor shall you take their daughters for your sons. You shall not seek their peace or their prosperity forever, so that you may be strong, and eat the good things of the land, and pass it on as an inheritance to your children forever.

verses.latin: Et post omnia quae venerunt super nos in operibus nostris pessimis, et in delicto nostro magno, quia tu, Deus noster, tenuisti ne percuteres nos secundum iniquitates nostras, et dedisti nobis salutem, sicut est hodie,
verses.english: And after all that has come upon us for our evil deeds and our great transgression, since You, our God, have restrained Yourself from striking us down according to our iniquities, and have given us such salvation as we have today,

verses.latin: numquid retractare poterimus mandata tua, et jungi populis qui exercent has abominationes? Numquid irasceris nobis usque ad consummationem, ne sit reliquia, et ut non sit salus?
verses.english: shall we then again violate Your commandments and join ourselves with these peoples who practice these detestable things? Will You not be angry with us even to utter destruction, so that there will be no remnant left, and no salvation?

verses.latin: Domine Deus Israel, justus es tu: quoniam derelicti sumus reliquiae, sicut dies ista. Ecce coram te sumus in delicto nostro: non enim possumus stare coram te super hoc.
verses.english: O Lord, God of Israel, You are just! For we are left as a mere remnant, as it is this day. Behold, we are before You in our transgression--we cannot stand before You because of this.

verses.latin: His itaque gestis, postquam conpleta est civitas, venerunt ad me principes, dicentes: Non est separatus populus Israël a populis terrarum, et a detestabilibus eorum, Chananaeis videlicet, et Hethaeis, et Pherezaeis, et Jebusaeis, et Ammonitis, et Moabitis, et Aegyptiis, et Amorrhaeis.
verses.english: After these things were done, once the city had been completed, the leaders of the people came to me, Ezra, and they said: 'The people of Israel have not kept themselves separate from the surrounding peoples of the lands, nor from their abominable practices. They are intermarrying with the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.'

verses.latin: Tulerunt enim de filiabus eorum sibi et filiis suis, et commiscuerunt semen sanctum cum populis terrarum: et manus principum et magistratuum primi fuerunt in hoc facinore.
verses.english: For they have taken wives from among the daughters of these foreign peoples for themselves and for their sons. This means they have mingled the holy seed of God's chosen people with the peoples of these other lands. And what is worse, the leaders and the rulers were the very first to commit this grave sin.

verses.latin: Hoc autem cum audissem, scidi pallium meum et tunicam, et evulsi capillos capitis mei et barba, et sedi moerens.
verses.english: When I, Ezra, heard this report, I tore my outer cloak and my inner tunic, a sign of extreme anguish and grief. I pulled out hair from my head and my beard in despair, and I sat down, utterly heartbroken.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt ad me omnes, qui timebant verbum Dei Israël, propter iniquitatem eorum qui de captivitate venerant, et ego sedebam tristis usque ad sacrificium vespertinum.
verses.english: Then all those who deeply feared the word and law of the God of Israel gathered around me, because of the great sin committed by those who had returned from exile. And I remained sitting in deep sorrow until the time of the evening sacrifice.

verses.latin: Et in tempore sacrificii vespertini, surrexi de afflictione mea, et flexis genibus meis, expandi manus meas ad Dominum Deum meum.
verses.english: At the time of the evening sacrifice, I finally rose from my posture of humiliation and intense mourning. I knelt down, and I spread out my hands in supplication to the Lord, my God.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Deus meus, confundor et erubesco levare faciem meam ad te: quoniam iniquitates nostrae multiplicatae sunt super caput nostrum, et delicta nostra creverunt usque ad caelum.
verses.english: And I said, 'Oh my God, I am utterly ashamed and blush to even lift my face toward You, because our iniquities have multiplied so greatly that they are overwhelming us. Our offenses have grown so immense that they seem to reach up to the very sky.'

verses.latin: A diebus patrum nostrorum usque ad diem hanc, in delicto magno sumus: et propter iniquitates nostras, traditi sumus ipsi, et reges nostri, et sacerdotes nostri, in manum regum terrarum, et in gladium, et in captivitatem, et in rapinam, et in confusionem vultus sicut et hodie.
verses.english: From the days of our ancestors right up to this very day, we have been in a state of great sin. Because of our iniquities, we ourselves, along with our kings and our priests, have been handed over into the power of the kings of foreign lands. We have been subjected to the sword, to captivity, to plunder, and to utter shame, a condition that remains evident even today.

verses.latin: Et nunc quasi parvulum quid et breve factum est ut haberemus residuum, et daret nobis palum in loco sanctificationis suae, et illuminaret oculos nostros Deus noster, et daret nobis refocillationem modicam in servitute nostra.
verses.english: And now, for what seems like a very brief and small moment, You have allowed us a remnant to survive. You have given us a secure foothold—a 'peg' in Your sanctuary, the Temple—establishing us firmly in Your holy place. Our God has enlightened our understanding, giving us hope, and has granted us a small measure of relief and refreshment in our continued servitude to foreign powers.

verses.latin: Quia servi sumus, et in servitute nostra non dereliquit nos Deus noster, sed inclinavit super nos misericordiam in conspectu regis Persarum, ut daret nobis refocillationem, et sublevaret domum Dei nostri, et instauraret solitudines ejus, et daret nobis sepem in Juda et Jerusalem.
verses.english: For even though we are servants, in our state of servitude, our God has not abandoned us. Instead, He has shown us great mercy in the eyes of the king of Persia, so that he would grant us relief and allow us to rebuild the house of our God, and restore its desolate ruins. He has also given us a protective wall and secure boundary in Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et nunc quid dicemus, Deus noster, post hæc? quia dereliquimus mandata tua.
verses.english: And now, O our God, what can we possibly say after all of this? For we have completely abandoned Your commandments, despite all Your mercy to us.

verses.latin: Quæ præcepisti in manu servorum tuorum prophetarum, dicens: Terra ad quam ingredimini ut possideatis eam, terra immunda est, juxta immunditiam populorum terrarum, abominationibus eorum quibus impleverunt eam ab ore usque ad os in coinquinatione sua.
verses.english: These are the commandments You gave through Your servants the prophets, saying: 'The land you are entering to possess is an unclean land. It is defiled according to the impurity of the peoples of these lands. They have filled it with their abominable practices, from one end to the other, in their thorough defilement.'

verses.latin: Et filias vestras non dabitis filiis eorum, et filias eorum non accipietis filiis vestris: et non quæretis pacem eorum, et prosperitatem eorum usque in æternum: ut confortemini, et comedatis bona terræ, et hæredes faciatis filios vestros usque in sempiternum.
verses.english: You were told: 'You shall not give your daughters to their sons in marriage, nor shall you take their daughters as wives for your sons. You shall never seek their peace or their prosperity, for you must remain separate. Do this so that you may be strong, and be able to eat the good things of the land, and pass on a secure inheritance to your sons forever.'

verses.latin: Et post omnia quæ venerunt super nos in operibus nostris pessimis, et in delicto nostro magno, quoniam tu, Deus noster, sanasti nos de iniquitate nostra, et dedisti nobis salutem sicut est hodie.
verses.english: And now, after all the calamities that have come upon us because of our very evil deeds and our great sin, even still, You, our God, have been merciful. You have spared us from the full punishment of our iniquity and have given us a measure of deliverance, as is evident today.

verses.latin: Numquid rursum prævaricabimur mandata tua, et jungemus nos populis abominabilium harum? nonne irasceris nobis usque ad internecionem, ne sit reliquiæ, et si salvi fuerimus?
verses.english: Shall we then again transgress Your commandments and join ourselves in marriage with these abominable peoples? If we do, will You not be so angry with us that You will utterly destroy us, leaving no remnant whatsoever, preventing any of us from surviving?

verses.latin: Domine Deus Israël, justus es tu: quoniam derelicti sumus reliquiæ, sicut est dies hæc. Ecce nos coram te in delicto nostro: non enim possumus stare coram te super hoc.
verses.english: O Lord, God of Israel, You are perfectly just in all Your ways! It is only because of Your mercy that a remnant of us has been left to survive, as is evident today. Behold, we stand before You utterly condemned by our sin; indeed, we are unable to stand before You in this state of guilt.

verses.latin: Igitur cum oraret Esdras, et confiteretur flens, et pronus jaceret ante templum Dei, collectus est ad eum de Israël coetus grandis nimis virorum et mulierum et puerorum: et flevit populus fletu magno.
verses.english: So, while Ezra was praying and confessing his sins, weeping and lying prostrate before God’s Temple, a very large crowd from Israel gathered around him—men, women, and children alike. And all the people wept with deep sorrow.

verses.latin: Et respondit Sechonias filius Jehiel de filiis Ælam, et dixit Esdrae: Nos peccavimus in Deum nostrum, et duximus uxores alienigenas de populis terræ: et nunc est super hoc Israël.
verses.english: Then Shechaniah, son of Jehiel, from the family of Elam, spoke to Ezra. He said: 'We have certainly sinned against our God by marrying foreign women from the surrounding nations. But even in this state, there remains hope for Israel to be restored.'

verses.latin: Ineamus igitur fœdus cum Deo nostro, ut projiciamus universas uxores, et eos qui de eis nati sunt, juxta voluntatem Domini, et eorum qui timent præceptum Domini Dei nostri: secundum legem fiat.
verses.english: 'So let us make a solemn covenant with our God. We must send away all these foreign wives and the children born from them. This must be done according to the clear will of the Lord and the desire of those who truly reverence the commandment of our Lord God. Let it be done strictly according to God’s Law.'

verses.latin: Surge, tuum est enim negotium, et nostrum tecum: confortare, et fac.
verses.english: 'Ezra, arise! This task is primarily yours, but we are with you to help. Be strong in the Lord, and carry out this command.'

verses.latin: Surrexit ergo Esdras, et adjuravit principes sacerdotum et Levitarum, et universum Israël, ut facerent secundum verbum hoc: et juraverunt.
verses.english: So Ezra stood up. He then put all the leaders of the priests, the Levites, and everyone in Israel under oath to carry out this command. And they all took the oath.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Esdras ante domum Dei, et abiit ad cubiculum Johanan filii Eliasib: ibique manens panem non comedit, et aquam non bibit: lugebat enim transgressionem eorum qui de captivitate venerant.
verses.english: Ezra then rose from his place before the Temple of God. He went to the living chamber of Johanan, son of Eliashib. While he stayed there, he refused to eat any bread or drink any water. He did this because he was deeply mourning the great sin committed by those who had returned from their captivity.

verses.latin: Et missum fecerunt in Juda et Jerusalem universis filiis Israël, ut convenirent in Jerusalem.
verses.english: A proclamation was then sent throughout Judah and Jerusalem to all the sons of Israel. They were commanded to gather together in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et omnis qui non venerit in tribus diebus juxta consilium principum et seniorum, auferetur universa substantia ejus, et ipse abjicietur de cœtu reversionis.
verses.english: It was decreed that anyone who failed to come within three days, following the counsel of the leaders and elders, would have all their possessions confiscated. Furthermore, that person would be permanently cut off from the entire community of those who had returned from captivity.

verses.latin: Convenit igitur omnis vir Juda et Benjamin in Jerusalem in tribus diebus, ipse est mensis nonus, vigesima die mensis: et sedit omnis populus in platea domus Dei, trementes pro peccato, et pro imbribus.
verses.english: So, within the specified three days, all the men from Judah and Benjamin gathered in Jerusalem. This was on the twentieth day of the ninth month. All the people sat in the open square before the House of God, shivering from both their sin and the heavy rains that were falling.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Esdras sacerdos, et dixit ad eos: Vos transgressi estis, et duxistis uxores alienigenas, ut adderetis super delictum Israël.
verses.english: Then Ezra the priest stood up and addressed them directly. He said: 'You have indeed transgressed God’s Law by marrying foreign women. By doing so, you have only added to the already great sin of Israel.'

verses.latin: Et nunc confitemini Domino Deo patrum vestrorum, et facite voluntatem ejus, et separamini a populis terræ, et ab uxoribus alienigenis.
verses.english: 'Now, confess your sins truly to the Lord God of your ancestors. Do His will exactly as He commands. Separate yourselves completely from the surrounding nations and from these foreign wives.'

verses.latin: Et respondit omnis cœtus, et dixit voce magna: Secundum verbum tuum ad nos, sic fiat.
verses.english: Then the entire assembly responded to Ezra, shouting with one voice: 'What you have spoken to us, let it be done exactly as you say!'

verses.latin: Verumtamen quia plures sunt hic, et tempus pluviæ, et non potestis stare foris, et opus non est unius diei vel duorum, (multi enim peccavimus in hoc)
verses.english: They added: 'However, there are many of us here, and it is the rainy season, so we cannot remain standing outside in these conditions. This is a task that cannot be completed in just one or two days, for many of us have committed this great sin.'

verses.latin: ordinentur principes in universo cœtu, et omnes in civitatibus nostris qui duxerunt uxores alienigenas veniant in tempore, et statuto die, et cum eis seniores per civitates et judices earum, donec avertatur ira Dei nostri a nobis super hoc peccato.
verses.english: 'Let leaders be appointed from among the whole assembly. Then, let all who have married foreign women throughout our cities come forward at a set time, on a specific appointed day. They should come with the elders and judges of their respective cities. This process must continue until the fierce wrath of our God concerning this grave sin is finally turned away from us.'

verses.latin: Porro Jonathas filius Azahel, et Jaasia filius Thecue resistebant huic: et Messullam et Sebethai Levites adjuvabant eos.
verses.english: However, Jonathan, son of Asahel, and Jahzeiah, son of Tikvah, openly opposed this course of action. Meshullam and Shabbethai, a Levite, actively supported their opposition.

verses.latin: Fecerunt autem sic filii Israël: et sederunt Esdras sacerdos, et viri principes familiarum in domo patrum suorum, et omnes per nomina sua. Et cœperunt quaerere rem istam in primo die mensis decimi.
verses.english: Despite the opposition, the sons of Israel proceeded with the plan. Ezra the priest, along with the designated heads of each family, assembled at the ancestral house. Each man was called by his name. They began to investigate this serious matter on the first day of the tenth month.

verses.latin: Et consummaverunt omnes viros qui duxerant uxores alienigenas, usque ad diem primam mensis primi.
verses.english: By the first day of the first month of the new year, they had completed the investigation concerning all the men who had married foreign women.

verses.latin: Et inventi sunt de filiis sacerdotum qui duxerant uxores alienigenas. De filiis Jesu filii Josedec, et fratribus ejus, Maasias, et Eliezer, et Jarib, et Godolia.
verses.english: Among the descendants of the priests, these were found to have married foreign women: From the line of Jeshua, son of Jozadak, and his brothers, these were: Maaseiah, Eliezer, Jarib, and Gedaliah.

verses.latin: Et dederunt manus suas ut ejicerent uxores suas, et pro delicto suo arietem de gregibus offerrent.
verses.english: They swore an oath, giving their hands in agreement, to send away their wives. Furthermore, as an atonement for their great sin, they committed to offering a ram from the flocks.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Emmer, Hanani, et Zebadia.
verses.english: From the family of Immer: Hanani and Zebadiah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Harim, Maasias, et Elia, et Semeia, et Jehiel, et Ozias.
verses.english: From the family of Harim: Maaseiah, Elijah, Shemaiah, Jehiel, and Uzziah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Pheshur, Elioenai, et Maasias, et Ismael, et Nathanael, et Jozabed, et Elasa.
verses.english: From the family of Pashhur: Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad, and Elasah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Levitis, Jozabed, et Semei, et Celaia ipse est Calita, Phathahia, et Juda, et Eliezer.
verses.english: Among the Levites: Jozabad, Shimei, Kelaiah (also known as Kelita), Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.

verses.latin: Et de cantoribus, Eliasib: et de janitoribus, Sellum, et Telem, et Uri.
verses.english: Among the Temple singers: Eliashib. Among the gatekeepers: Shallum, Telem, and Uri.

verses.latin: Et ex Israël, de filiis Pharos, Remeia, et Jezia, et Melchia, et Miamin, et Eleazar, et Melchia, et Banea.
verses.english: From the rest of Israel, specifically from the family of Parosh: Ramiah, Jeziah, Malchiah, Mijamin, Eleazar, Malchiah (again), and Benaiah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Ælam, Mathania, Zacharia, et Jehiel, et Abdi, et Jerimoth, et Elia.
verses.english: From the family of Elam: Mattaniah, Zechariah, Jehiel, Abdi, Jeremoth, and Elijah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Zethua, Elioenai, Eliasib, Mathania, et Jerimoth, et Zabad, et Aziza.
verses.english: From the family of Zattu: Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, Jeremoth, Zabad, and Aziza.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Bebai, Johanan, Hanania, Zabbai, Athalai.
verses.english: From the family of Bebai: Johanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, and Athlai.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Bani, Messullam, et Melluch, et Adaia, Jasub, et Saal, et Ramoth.
verses.english: From the family of Bani: Meshullam, Malluch, Adaiah, Jashub, Sheal, and Ramoth.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Phahath Moab, Edna, et Calal, Banaia, et Maasias, Mathanias, Beseleel, Banni, et Manasse.
verses.english: From the family of Pahath-Moab: Edna, Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel, Binnui, and Manasseh.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Harim, Eliezer, Josia, Melchia, Semeia, Simeon,
verses.english: From the family of Harim: Eliezer, Isshiah, Malchiah, Shemaiah, and Simeon.

verses.latin: Benjamin, Malluch, Samaria.
verses.english: Also, Benjamin, Malluch, and Shemariah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Hasum, Mathanai, Matthatha, Zabad, Eliphalat, Jermai, Manasse, Semei.
verses.english: From the family of Hashum: Mattanai, Mattathah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei.

verses.latin: De filiis Bani, Maadai, Amram, et Uel,
verses.english: From the family of Bani: Maadai, Amram, and Uel.

verses.latin: Banaia, Bedia, Cheluhi,
verses.english: Also Benaiah, Bedeiah, and Cheluhi.

verses.latin: Vania, Marimuth, Eliasib,
verses.english: Vaniah, Meremoth, and Eliashib.

verses.latin: Mathania, Mathanai, et Jasi,
verses.english: Mattaniah, Mattanai, and Jaasai.

verses.latin: Bani, et Benni, Semei,
verses.english: Bani, Binnui, and Shimei.

verses.latin: Et Salmia, et Nathan, et Adaia,
verses.english: Shelemiah, Nathan, and Adaiah.

verses.latin: Mechadnabai, Sasai, Sarai,
verses.english: Machnadebai, Shashai, and Sharai.

verses.latin: Cum ergo complerentur haec, et Ezra orans, et confitens fleret, et jaceret ante templum Dei, collectus est ad eum de Israël coetus grandis nimis virorum et mulierum et puerorum: et flevit populus fletu magno.
verses.english: When all these things were taking place, Ezra was praying, confessing the sins of the people, weeping, and lying prostrate before God’s temple. A very large assembly of men, women, and children from all of Israel gathered around him, and the people wept with great and loud lamentation.

verses.latin: Et respondens Sechania filius Jehiel de filiis Elam, ait Ezræ: Nos peccavimus in Deum nostrum, et duximus uxores alienigenas de populis terræ: et nunc est Israël super hoc.
verses.english: Then Shecaniah, the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, spoke to Ezra and said: “We have sinned greatly against our God and have taken foreign wives from the peoples of the land. But even in this, there is still hope for Israel.”

verses.latin: Agamus itaque fœdus cum Deo nostro, ut projiciamus universas uxores, et eos qui de his nati sunt, juxta voluntatem Domini, et eorum qui timent præceptum Dei nostri: et secundum legem fiat.
verses.english: “Therefore, let us now make a covenant with our God to send away all these wives and their children, according to the will of the Lord and of those who fear the commandments of our God. Let it be done according to the Law.”

verses.latin: Surge, tuum est enim negotium, et nostrum est tecum: confortare, et fac.
verses.english: “Rise up, Ezra, for this task is yours, and we are with you. Be strong, and carry it out.”

verses.latin: Surrexit ergo Ezra, et adjuravit principes sacerdotum, et levitarum, et omnem Israël, ut facerent secundum verbum hoc: et juraverunt.
verses.english: So Ezra rose up and made the chief priests, the Levites, and all the people of Israel swear an oath that they would do according to this command. And they all swore the oath.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Ezra ante domum Dei, et abiit ad cubiculum Johanan filii Eliasib: et introivit illuc, et panem non comedit, et aquam non bibit: lugebat enim transgressionem eorum qui de captivitate venerant.
verses.english: Then Ezra went from before the house of God and entered the chamber of Johanan, the son of Eliashib. When he went in there, he ate no bread and drank no water, for he was still mourning over the unfaithfulness of those who had returned from captivity.

verses.latin: Et emisit vocem in universo Juda et Jerusalem ad omnes filios transmigrationis, ut congregarentur in Jerusalem:
verses.english: And they sent out a proclamation throughout all of Judah and Jerusalem to all the exiles, calling them to gather in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: et omnis qui non venerat in diebus tribus juxta consilium principum et seniorum, omnis substantia ejus auferretur, et ipse abjiceretur de cœtu transmigrationis.
verses.english: Whoever did not come within three days, according to the decision of the leaders and elders, would have all his possessions confiscated, and he himself would be excluded from the assembly of the exiles.

verses.latin: Convenerunt itaque omnis vir Juda et Benjamin in Jerusalem in tribus diebus, ipse est mensis nonus, vigesima mensis: et sedit omnis populus in platea domus Dei, trementes pro peccato, et pro imbribus nivosis.
verses.english: So all the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered in Jerusalem within three days. It was the ninth month, on the twentieth day of the month. All the people sat in the open square before the house of God, trembling both because of their sin and because of the heavy rain.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Ezra sacerdos, et dixit ad eos: Vos transgressi estis, et duxistis uxores alienigenas, ut adderetis super delictum Israël.
verses.english: Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them: “You have trespassed and have taken foreign wives, thus adding to the guilt of Israel.”

verses.latin: Et nunc date confessionem Domino Deo patrum vestrorum, et facite placitum ejus: et separamini a populis terræ, et ab uxoribus alienigenis.
verses.english: “Now, therefore, give confession to the Lord, the God of your fathers, and do His will. Separate yourselves from the peoples of the land and from your foreign wives.”

verses.latin: Et respondit omnis cœtus, et dixit voce magna: Juxta verbum tuum ad nos, sic fiat.
verses.english: Then all the assembly answered with a loud voice, saying: “As you have said to us, so let it be done!”

verses.latin: Verumtamen quia plures sunt hi qui peccaverunt in hoc, et tempus pluviarum est, et non potestur foris stare, et opus non est unius diei vel duorum, (multisque quippe peccavimus in sermone hoc)
verses.english: “However, because there are many who have sinned in this matter, and it is the rainy season, we cannot stand outside. This work cannot be finished in just one or two days, for indeed, many of us have sinned grievously in this matter.”

verses.latin: præponantur principes in universo cœtu: et omnes in civitatibus nostris qui duxerunt uxores alienigenas, veniant in temporibus statutis, et cum his seniores per civitates et judices earum, donec avertatur ira Dei nostri a nobis super hoc peccato.
verses.english: “Therefore, let our leaders be appointed for the entire assembly. Let all those in our cities who have taken foreign wives come at appointed times, along with the elders and judges of each city, until the fierce wrath of our God concerning this sin is turned away from us.”

verses.latin: Jonathan filius Azahel, et Jaasia filius Thecue resistebant: et Messollam et Sebethai Levites adjuvabant eos.
verses.english: Only Jonathan, the son of Asahel, and Jahzeiah, the son of Tikvah, opposed this plan; and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite supported them in their opposition.

verses.latin: Feceruntque ita filii transmigrationis. Et abierunt Ezra sacerdos, et viri principes familiarum in domos patrum suorum, et omnis per nomina sua, et sederunt in die prima mensis decimi ut quærerent rem.
verses.english: The exiles did as they had agreed. Ezra the priest and certain men, heads of ancestral households, all designated by name, went to their homes. They began their investigation on the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.

verses.latin: Et consummaverunt omnes viros qui duxerant uxores alienigenas, usque ad diem primam mensis primi.
verses.english: By the first day of the first month, they had finished dealing with all the men who had taken foreign wives.

verses.latin: Et inventi sunt de filiis sacerdotum qui duxerant uxores alienigenas. De filiis Josue filii Josedec, et fratrum ejus, Maasia, et Eliezer, et Jarib, et Godolia.
verses.english: Among the sons of the priests who had taken foreign wives were these: From the sons of Jeshua, son of Jozadak, and his brothers: Maaseiah, Eliezer, Jarib, and Gedaliah.

verses.latin: Et dederunt manus suas ut ejicerent uxores suas, et pro delicto suo arietem de ovibus offerrent.
verses.english: They gave their hands in solemn agreement to send away their wives, and for their guilt, they offered a ram from the flock as a sin offering.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Emmer: Hanani, et Zabadias.
verses.english: From the sons of Immer: Hanani and Zebadiah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Harim: Maasia, et Elia, et Semeia, et Jehiel, et Ozias.
verses.english: From the sons of Harim: Maaseiah, Elijah, Shemaiah, Jehiel, and Uzziah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Pheshur: Elioenai, Maasia, Ismael, Nathanael, Jozabed, et Elasa.
verses.english: From the sons of Pashhur: Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad, and Elasah.

verses.latin: Et de Levitis: Jozabed, et Semei, et Celaia ipse est Celita, Pethaia, Juda, et Eliezer.
verses.english: From the Levites: Jozabad, Shimei, Kelaiah (who is also Kelita), Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.

verses.latin: Et de cantoribus: Eliasib: et de janitoribus: Sellum, et Telem, et Uri.
verses.english: From the singers: Eliashib. And from the gatekeepers: Shallum, Telem, and Uri.

verses.latin: Et ex Israël, de filiis Pharos: Remia, et Jezia, et Melchia, et Miamin, et Eleazar, et Melchia, et Banea.
verses.english: From the common people of Israel: From the sons of Parosh: Ramiah, Izziah, Malchijah, Mijamin, Eleazar, Malchijah, and Benaiah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Ælam: Mathania, Zacharia, et Jehiel, et Abdi, et Jerimoth, et Elia.
verses.english: From the sons of Elam: Mattaniah, Zechariah, Jehiel, Abdi, Jeremoth, and Elijah.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Zethoa: Elioenai, Eliasib, Mathania, Jerimoth, Zabad, et Aziza.
verses.english: From the sons of Zattu: Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, Jeremoth, Zabad, and Aziza.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Babai: Jochanan, Hanania, Zabei, Athalai.
verses.english: From the sons of Bebai: Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, and Athlai.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Bani: Mosollam, et Melluch, et Adaia, Jasub, et Saal, et Ramoth.
verses.english: From the sons of Bani: Meshullam, Malluch, Adaiah, Jashub, Sheal, and Jeremoth.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Phahath Moab: Edna, et Chalal, Banea, et Maasia, Mathania, Beseleel, et Benui, et Manasse.
verses.english: From the sons of Pahath-Moab: Adna, Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel, Binnui, and Manasseh.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Harim: Eliezer, Josia, Melchia, Semeia, Simeon,
verses.english: From the sons of Harim: Eliezer, Ishijah, Malchijah, Shemaiah, Simeon,

verses.latin: Benjamin, Malluch, Samaria.
verses.english: Benjamin, Malluch, and Shemariah.

verses.latin: De filiis Hasom: Mathanai, Mathatha, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jermai, Manasse, Semei.
verses.english: From the sons of Hashum: Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei.

verses.latin: De filiis Bani: Maaddi, Amram, et Uel,
verses.english: From the sons of Bani: Maadai, Amram, and Uel,

verses.latin: Banea, Bedaia, Cheliau,
verses.english: Benaiah, Bedeiah, Cheluhi,

verses.latin: Vania, Marimuth, et Eliasib,
verses.english: Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib,

verses.latin: Mathania, Mathanai, et Jasi,
verses.english: Mattaniah, Mattenai, and Jaasai,

verses.latin: Et Bani, et Benui, Semei,
verses.english: Bani, Binnui, Shimei,

verses.latin: Et Salem, et Nathan, et Adaia,
verses.english: Shelemiah, Nathan, and Adaiah,

verses.latin: Et Mechadnabai, Sisai, Sarai,
verses.english: Machnadebai, Shashai, Sharai,
